edu.gatech.cs2340.trydent

Class GameObject

  • java.lang.Object
    • edu.gatech.cs2340.trydent.GameObject

  • public class GameObject
extends java.lang.Object
    Basic GameObject all visual elements of a game should either use directly or extend.

    • Method Detail

      • playAnimation

        public void playAnimation(Animation animation)
        Plays the given animation, stopping any currently playing animations. Animations modify the position, rotate, and scale of an object over time.

        Parameters:
        animation - the animation to play

      • loopAnimation

        public void loopAnimation(Animation animation,
                          int count)
        Plays the given animation, stopping any currently playing animations, and loops it count number of times.

        Animations modify the position, rotate, and scale of an object over time.

        Parameters:
        animation - the animation to loop
        count - The number of times to play the animation. count = 0 will not play anything, count = 1 will play the animation exactly once. A negative value for count will cause the animation to loop infinitely.

      • loopAnimation

        public void loopAnimation(Animation animation)
        Plays the given animation in a loop forever.

        Animations modify the position, rotation, and scale of an object over time.

        Parameters:
        animation - the animation to loop

      • stopAnimation

        public void stopAnimation()
        Stops the currently playing animation.

        Parameters:

        y - the y displacement

      • translate

        public void translate(BaseVector<?> by)
        Translates (aka moves) this object in global space by the given amount.
        Parameters:
        by - the 2D displacement

      • scale

        public void scale(double sx,
                  double sy)
        Scales this object by the given amount. Non-uniform scalings (ie not scaling sx and sy by the same amount) are not recommended as they can have undesirable effects (shearing) if this object has rotated children.
        Parameters:
        sx - the x scale
        sy - the y scale

      • scale

        public void scale(Scale scale)
        Scales this object by the given amount. Non-uniform scalings (ie not scaling sx and sy by the same amount) are not recommended as they can have undesirable effects (shearing) if this object has rotated children.
        Parameters:
        scale - the 2D scale

      • getPosition

        public Position getPosition()
        Returns this objects global (x, y) position.
        Returns:
        the current position (changing the returned value will not affect the position of this object)

        public double getRotation()
        Returns this object's global rotation in degrees.
        Returns:
        the 2D rotation

        public Scale getScale()

        the 2D scale (changing the returned value will not affect the scale of this object)
